item.description:
You're invited to join us in our home to watch and discuss the movie, "I am".

 

Tom Shadyac was the director of "Ace Ventura, Liar Liar, and Bruce Almighty.  He was in a cycling accident that left him incapacitated, possibly for good.  Ultimately, he recovered, and emerged a changed man.

This movie is about his journey, and his new questions, which he asks in interviews with remarkable men and women from the worlds of science, philosophy, and faith.

He begins with the question, "What's wrong with the world, and what can we do to make it better?".  In his quest, he learns the value of asking "What's right with the world?", and about the miraculous, interconnectedness of life.

Let's watch together, and discuss the questions and thoughts it stirs up for us about the law of attraction and manifesting. 

Please be considerate.  If your plans change, let us know or change your RSVP.

Popcorn and snacks will be provided; and contributions are welcome!

Note: We have a cat. If you need us to keep him in another room, please let us know.

Directions and Parking at Ann and Mark’s home:
276 Edmands Rd., Framingham, MA, 01701
Phone:508-405-1686

Since we don’t know where you’ll be coming from, you’ll just have to MapQuest or something. You’ll get to discover the beautiful countryside part of Framingham!

We live down a long driveway, so remember to look for our white mailbox at the end. It has our name and house # on it. We're across from a big, old white house, with a small vegetable garden on the front lawn.
Because space is limited and maneuverability challenging, please follow these instructions so we can fit in the most cars and people will be able to leave more easily, as well. Please park as efficiently as possible.

1. When you arrive, drive up to our house and turn around to drive back out, then pull into any space along the driveway that you can find. There are a good number of spots where there is room to pull over and park, and still leave room for people to drive by. If it is muddy or slushy, DO NOT park there, as you might get stuck or slide down the ridge.
There are also a couple of spots in front of the green storage hut (don’t worry about the weeds.) If you park efficiently, at least 2 cars should be able to pull in there. Wherever you park, if you can, it will be easier to get out if you park facing the road.

2. Once all the spots along the driveway are taken, the next place to park is in front of the garage. Please park as tightly as possible so 3 cars can fit there . I also recommend backing in, if you can.

3. A couple of cars can pull up a little bit along the side driveway, if the first person pulls up enough to allow for a second to fit behind.

4. After cars are parked in front of the garage, then a few people can park in the area around the basketball hoop, and by the big tree in the middle.

5. Recommended: Up the road just a little bit, is Garvey Road, where there is plenty of legal, safe, lit parking along the street, and a very short, easy walk back to our house. Framingham has a strange parking law: If it's an even numbered year, you need to park on the even numbered side of the street.  If it's an odd numbered year, park on odd numbered side of street.  Since this is 2012, park on the even side!
 

Thank you for co-operating!
item.how_to_find_us: We're down a long driveway. Look for white mailbox with our name and #276, across from large, old, white house

group.name: "Good Vibrations" Metro West Law of Attraction Community

item.name: Movie night! "I AM"
